newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia to issue three-year bond on July 23.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia to issue three-year bond on July 23.

text.p: Slovenia's government said on Thursday it would issue a three-year bond on July 23 worth up to five billion tolars ($31.5 million) in order to cover the budget deficit.
The bond would carry an interest rate of six percent over Slovenia's basic interest rate TOM and would be denominated in 100,000 tolars. Interest rates would be paid bi-annually.
TOM, which changes monthly according to the rate of inflation over the past 12 months, reflected a monthly rate of 0.7 percent in July.
The bonds will be offered to Slovenian banks who will be able to sell them to other buyers.
Slovenia expects to have a budget deficit of 26.7 billion tolars in the first nine months of this year. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
